meanings.definition: To fix firmly in a surrounding mass
meanings.sent1: She was embedding the seeds into the soil to help them grow.
meanings.sent2: The roots of the tree were embedding deeply into the ground.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was embedding its acorns in various places around the garden.
meanings.sent4: His words were embedding themselves in her mind, leaving a lasting impact.
meanings.sent5: The memories of that day were embedding themselves in her heart, never to be forgotten.

meanings.sent1: The spider was embedding itself in the corner of the room.
meanings.sent2: The vines were embedding the old house, giving it a mysterious look.
meanings.sent3: The cat was embedding itself in the pile of blankets, pretending to be invisible.
meanings.sent4: The feeling of excitement was embedding itself in her heart, making her smile uncontrollably.
meanings.sent5: The sense of peace was embedding itself in the room, calming everyone down.

meanings.definition: To insert (a media file, such as a graphic, video, or audio clip) into a computer document
meanings.sent1: She was embedding the image into the presentation to make it more visually appealing.
meanings.sent2: The video was embedding seamlessly into the website, enhancing the user experience.
meanings.sent3: The music was embedding itself into the background of the video, setting the mood perfectly.
meanings.sent4: The idea was embedding itself into her mind, sparking a wave of creativity.
meanings.sent5: The sound effects were embedding themselves into the game, making it more immersive.
